name: Classic Margarita
instructions: Run a lime wedge around the outer rim of a rocks glass and dip in salt. Add tequila, lime juice, and Cointreau to a shaker with ice. Shake well until chilled. Strain into the prepared glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wheel.

name: Hibiscus Sunrise
instructions: Combine hibiscus tea, orange juice, lime juice, and agave nectar in a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a salt-rimmed glass over fresh ice. Garnish with an orange slice.

name: Kiddi-Rita
instructions: Add orange juice, lemonade, and lime juice to a fun glass with ice and stir. Gently pour in a splash of grenadine, which will sink to the bottom creating a sunrise effect. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Old Fashioned
instructions: Place the sugar cube in an Old Fashioned glass. Wet it with bitters and a splash of water. Muddle until dissolved. Add a large ice cube, then pour in the whiskey. Stir gently. Garnish with an orange peel.

name: No-Fashioned
instructions: In a mixing glass with ice, combine the chilled smoked tea, spiced simple syrup, and non-alcoholic bitters. Stir until well-chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over a large ice cube. Garnish with an orange twist.

name: Spiced Cherry Coke
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Pour in Coca-Cola and grenadine. Add a small dash of cinnamon and stir gently. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Classic Mojito
instructions: In a sturdy glass, gently muddle the mint leaves, sugar, and lime juice. Add the rum and fill the glass with crushed ice. Top with soda water and stir. Garnish with a mint sprig and lime wheel.

name: Virgin Mojito
instructions: In a sturdy glass, gently muddle the mint leaves, sugar, and lime juice. Fill the glass with crushed ice. Top with sparkling water or soda and stir well. Garnish with a mint sprig and lime wedge.

name: Minty Limeade
instructions: Gently clap the mint leaves between your hands to release their aroma and place them in a glass. Fill the glass with ice. Add lime juice and top with lemon-lime soda. Stir gently. Garnish with a lime wheel.
